title: How to Convert Word to PDF in Office 2007

steps.title: Open your file in Microsoft Word.
steps.content: Open your file in Microsoft Word. If you have Office 2007 applications, Word will be one of them.

steps.title: Click the File tab.
steps.content: Click the File tab. You'll see this in the editing bar along the top of your screen.

steps.title: Click Save As.
steps.content: Click Save As . It's an option in the File tab and will prompt you to make a choice.

steps.title: Click PDF or XPS.
steps.content: Click PDF or XPS . You'll see this above the "Other Formats" option.

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . This button is towards the right side of the window.

steps.title: Check the box next to "ISO 19005-1 compliant (PDF/A)" and click OK.
steps.content: Check the box next to "ISO 19005-1 compliant (PDF/A)" and click OK . This makes sure that your Word file is saved in PDF form with the same structure, format, and visual style.

steps.title: Click Publish.
steps.content: Click Publish . Your Word file will save as a PDF in the location specified in that window. [1] X Research source
